intro: Adenostemma pakaraimae, commonly known as the Pakaraima milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, making it a plant to handle with care.
